Class ec.e.openers.Surgeon 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.e.openers.Opener
           |
           +----ec.e.openers.RefOpener
                   |
                   +----ec.e.openers.Surgeon
public class Surgeon
extends RefOpener
An Opener for non-scalar non-arrays. A Surgeon violates the encapsulation of the objects it opens, and hence grants mucho authority. Further, Surgeons beget Surgeons, so a Surgeon grants authority to violate the encapsulation of a set of objects. Outside the TCB, one can only make encapsulation violating Surgeons by using a ClassRecipe whose authority must derive from the all-powerful RootClassRecipe.

Surgeon delegates approval of FieldKnives to its OpenerRecipe's ClassRecipe. By deciding which are ok, a ClassRecipe defines which instance variable declarations "exist" in the world as presented by this Opener. On encoding, variables that aren't ok are ignored.

XXX not true: On decode, they are set according to their class's default (no argument) constructor.

XXX unfortunately true instead: On decode, reference veriables are set to null, and scalar variables are set to the zero value for their type.

commentary()
Currently returns an array of the ok instance variable names (preceded with commentary from a base Chef, if any).
decodeBody(Object, RtDecoder)
Decode into the ok instance variables of 'obj' according to their declared types.
decodePreface(RtDecoder)
If there's a base Chef, have it instantiate my type and decode the preface.
encodeBody(Object, RtEncoder)
Encode the ok instance variables of 'obj' onto 'encoder' according to their declared types.
encodePreface(Object, RtEncoder)
Just encodes according to a base Chef, if any.
getSuper()
The Opener for the superclass of this class, or null if this class is Object.
instVarOpener(int)
Returns an opener for the i'th ok instance variable declaration.
numInstVars()
How many ok declared instance variables are there? (Doesn't count those handled by my base Chef, if any.)
toString()
Returns a String that represents the value of this Object.

  public RefOpener getSuper()
The Opener for the superclass of this class, or null if this class is Object. Unlike Class.getSuperclass(), super() on an Opener for an interface will return the Opener for class Object.
